SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.math

Class MathUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.math.MathUtil
public final class MathUtil extends Object
Utility class providing various mathematical helper functions and constants.

This class contains methods for root finding, angle normalization, logarithmic and power calculations, rounding, and quadrant/octant determination, among others. It also includes constants commonly used in mathematical calculations.

      public static final double GOLDEN_RATIO
      Represents the mathematical constant known as the Golden Ratio, denoted by the Greek letter phi (φ). This is an irrational number approximately equal to 1.618033988749895 and is often encountered in mathematics, art, architecture, and nature.
      See Also:

    • E

      public static final double E
      A mathematical constant representing Euler's number (e), the base of the natural logarithm. It is an irrational constant approximately equal to 2.7182818284590455.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LN_2

      public static final double LN_2
      Represents the natural logarithm of 2 (ln(2)), a constant value approximately equal to 0.6931471805599453. This constant is often used in mathematical calculations and algorithms that involve logarithms with a natural base.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SQRT_2

      public static final double SQRT_2
      A constant that represents the square root of 2 (√2) with high precision. The square root of 2 is an irrational number that is approximately equal to 1.4142135623730951.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SQRT_3

      public static final double SQRT_3
      A constant holding the square root of 3, approximately 1.7320508075688772. This value is often used in mathematical calculations and geometry-related computations.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SQRT_5

      public static final double SQRT_5
      Represents the square root of 5 as a constant value. This value is computed to a high precision and is commonly used in mathematical calculations requiring the square root of 5.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • findRoot

      public static double findRoot(DoubleUnaryOperator f, double xa, double xb, double eps)
      Find root of function. The root finding uses a modified secant algorithm. The values given as staring points should be rough approximations of the root, i.e., the algorithm might fail if the second order derivative changes sign in the interval [xa,root] or [xb,root].
      Parameters:
      f - the function for which the root shall be calculated
      xa - first starting point
      xb - second starting point
      eps - desired accuracy
      Returns:
      the calculated root or Double.NaN if none is found

    • findRootsInInterval

      public static List<Double> findRootsInInterval(DoubleUnaryOperator f, double x0, double x1, int steps, double eps)
      Find all roots within the given interval. The function is evaluated a fixed number of times to find starting values for root finding.
      Parameters:
      f - the function
      x0 - first limit of the interval
      x1 - second limit of the interval; it must be different from x0
      steps - maximum number of iterations
      eps - maximum error
      Returns:
      list of all calculated roots

    • gcd

      public static long gcd(long a, long b)
      Calculate the greatest common divisor. The greatest common divisor is calculated using the Euclidean algorithm.
      Parameters:
      a - first argument
      b - second argument
      Returns:
      greatest common divisor of a and b.

    • ilog10

      public static int ilog10(double x)
      Calculate ceil(log10(x)).
      Parameters:
      x - argument
      Returns:
      ceil(log10 ( x))

      Test if number is integral.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true, if a is integral

    • pow10

      public static double pow10(int i)
      Calculate powers of 10.
      Parameters:
      i - the exponent to use
      Returns:
      10 raised to the power of i

    • round

      public static double round(double x, int n)
      Round to decimal places.

      Note: If this is a bulk operation, consider using roundingOperation(int, RoundingMode) instead as the scale calculation will take place only once per instance.

      Round x to n decimal places according to RoundingMode.HALF_UP, i.e., 1.5 will be rounded to 2 and -1.5 will be rounded to -1.

      The number of places n may be negative, resulting in rounding taking place before the decimal point, i.e. round(125, -1)=130.

      Examples rounding to two digits precision:

      • 0.123 -> 0.12
      • 12.3 -> 12.3
      • 123 -> 123
      • 0.125 -> 0.13
      • -0.125 -> -0.12
      Parameters:
      x - value to round
      n - number of decimal places
      Returns:
      x rounded to n decimal places

    • roundToPrecision

      public static double roundToPrecision(double x, int p)
      Round to precision.

      Round x to p digits of precision according to RoundingMode.HALF_UP.

      Examples rounding to two digits precision:

      • 0.123 -> 0.12
      • 12.3 -> 12
      • 123 -> 120
      Parameters:
      x - value to round
      p - number of digits (p must be positive)
      Returns:
      x rounded to p digits precision

    • roundingOperation

      public static DoubleUnaryOperator roundingOperation(int n, RoundingMode mode)
      Get the operation that performs rounding to a fixed number of decimal places.

      Round x to n decimal places according to the supplied RoundingMode.

      If RoundingMode.UNNECESSARY is used, x is returned unchanged.

      The number of places n may be negative, resulting in rounding taking place before the decimal point.

      Parameters:
      n - number of decimal places
      mode - the RoundingMode to use
      Returns:
      operation that performs the requested rounding

    • getRoundingOperation

      public static DoubleUnaryOperator getRoundingOperation(RoundingMode mode)
      Get a DoubleUnaryOperator that implements rounding according to the requested mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - the RoundingMode
      Returns:
      rounding operation
